titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2811) to provide for a responsible increase to the debt ceiling, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 39) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Commerce relating to "Procedures Covering Suspension of Liquidation, Duties and Estimated Duties in Accord With Presidential Proclamation 10414".

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2811) to provide for a responsible increase to the debt ceiling, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 39) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Commerce relating to "Procedures Covering Suspension of Liquidation, Duties and Estimated Duties in Accord With Presidential Proclamation 10414".

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-43, by Mr. Cole.

Resolution provides for two hours of general debate on H.R. 2811 and one hour of general debate on H.J. Res. 39. The previous question is considered as ordered with one motion to recommit allowed on each measure.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 14.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 327.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 327, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question on the resolution, and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.

Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 327 - "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2811) to provide for a responsible increase to the debt ceiling, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 39) disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Commerce relating to "Procedures Covering Suspension of Liquidation, Duties and Estimated Duties in Accord With Presidential Proclamation 10414"."
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 210 (Roll no. 195).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 219 - 210 (Roll no. 196).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of
H.R. 2811 (Limit, Save, Grow Act of 2023, which increases the federal debt limit, decreases spending, repeals several energy tax credits, expands work requirements for some means-tested programs, and nullifies regulations for canceling federal student loan debt), and H.J. Res. 39 (which nullifies a rule submitted by the Department of Commerce that allows for the suspension of duties on certain solar panels that are completed in Cambodia, Malaysia, Thailand or Vietnam and use certain Chinese parts and components).
